clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Diagnostic Cervical Medial Branch Block
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Guided Diagnostic Cervical Medial Branch Block

brief_summary.textblock: The diagnostic cervical branch block for neck pain due to cervical facet joint pain has been traditionally done under fluoroscopic guidance. Its diagnostic value and technique have been well established. However, recently some studies have shown that the diagnostic cervical and lumbar medial branch block can be done under ultrasound guidance.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The PI has been unable to continue with the study.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the efficacy of the use of ultrasound for diagnostic cervical medial branch block on pain patients who have developed neck pain, cervicogenic headache, or shoulder pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interventional pain procedure studies on chronic pain patients

arm_group.description: It will involve 5 volunteers and they will undergo C arm fluoroscopic guided cervical medial branch blocks (C2-C7) on unilateral position and then followed by the 3D ultrasound machine for visualization of needle position.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Candidates for upper and lower cervial medical branch blocks
arm_group.description: This will involve 25 patients and they will follow the same procedures as the healthy volunteers.

intervention.intervention_name: cervical medial branch blocks using the Quincke spinal needle
intervention.description: #25 gauge 1 and 1/2 inch long needle and #25 gauge 10cm long Quincke spinal needle will be used for placement.
intervention.arm_group_label: Candidates for upper and lower cervial medical branch blocks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy volunteers
- patients who have headache, neck pain, and shoulder pain due to possible facet joint disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients/volunteers with BMI > 35
- patients/volunteers with short thick neck
- coagulopathy
- allergy to local anesthetic, ultrasound gel
- patient unable to fill out post procedure pain diary
